choices.A: Server 1 will receive 25% of the sessions, Server 2 will receive 75% of the sessions
choices.D: Server 1 will receive 0% of the sessions, Server 2 will receive 100% of the sessions
choices.B: Server 1 will receive 20% of the sessions, Server 2 will receive 66 6% of the sessions
choices.C: Server 1 will receive 33.3% of the sessions, Server 2 will receive 66 6% of the sessions

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
FortiWeb only routes connections for the pool to a backup server when all the other members of the server pool fail their server health check.

The backup server mechanism does not work if you do not specify server health checks for the pool members.

Selected Answer: C
No Healthcheck, so Backup-Server does not work.
C is correct.

Selected Answer: D
Server 1 is only Backup!

comments.content:
No Healthcheck, so Backup-Server does not work. 
C is correct.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
weighted-round-robinâ€”Distributes new connections using the round robin method, except that members with a higher weight value receive a larger percentage of connections.
server-balance {enable | disable} >> Specifies whether the pool contains a single server or multiple members. If the value is enabled, FortiWeb uses the specified load-balancing algorithm to distribute TCP connections among the members

A is correct 

The Server Pool in the exhibit is configured with a weight of 20 for server 1 and a weight of 60 for server 2. This means that server 1 will receive 20% of the sessions and server 2 will receive 75% of the sessions.

The following formula is used to calculate the load balancing between servers in a Server Pool:

weight_of_server_1 / (weight_of_server_1 + weight_of_server_2)

In this case, the formula is:

20 / (20 + 60) = 20 / 80 = 0.25 = 25%

Therefore, server 1 will receive 25% of the sessions and server 2 will receive 75% of the sessions.

discussion.content:
Prefix-list:

 Rule 1 matches prefixes from 172.16.201.0/24 to 172.16.201.15/28.
 Rule 2 matches prefixes from 172.16.204.0/24 to 172.16.204.3/30.

Now, let's see which routes will be active based on the prefix-list:

A. 172.16.204.128/25 - This route is not covered by any rule in the prefix-list.
B. 172.16.201.96/29 - This route falls within the range of rule 1 (172.16.201.0/24 to 172.16.201.15/28), so it will be active.
C. 172.16.201.64/27 - This route falls within the range of rule 1 (172.16.201.0/24 to 172.16.201.15/28), so it will be active.
D. 172.16.204.64/27 - This route is not covered by any rule in the prefix-list.

So, the two routes that will be active in the routing table on the HQ firewall are:

B. 172.16.201.96/29
C. 172.16.201.64/27

Selected Answer: AC
Is A and C

Refer to the exhibits.

Topology -
//IMG//


Configuration -
//IMG//

The exhibits show a diagram of a requested topology and the base IPsec configuration.
A customer asks you to configure ADVPN via two internet underlays. The requirement is that you use one interface with a single IP address on DC FortiGate.
In this scenario, which feature should be implemented to achieve this requirement?

discussion.content: It is not possible to establish two IPSEC tunnels between the same two FGT IPs, unless the Network Overlay ID differs between these two tunnels. Thus, the answer is A.

Selected Answer: A
The network ID is a Fortinet-proprietary attribute that is used to select the correct
phase 1 between IPsec peers, so that multiple IKEv2 tunnels can be established
between the same local/remote gateway pairs.In static phase 1 configurations, network-id is used with the pair of gateway IPs
to negotiate the correct tunnel with a matching network-id. This allows IPsec
peers to use the same pair of underlay IPs to establish multiple IPsec tunnels.
Without it, only a single tunnel can be established over the same pair of underlay
IPs.

Selected Answer: C
Without Local-id hubs won't be able to connect to hub, they dont know to which VPN connect.
Network-id would be used if hubs would have only one ISP, which is not the case.

choices.C: current configuration already fulfills the requirement
